sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an equilateral triangle.
message_1: A triangle ABC is an equilateral triangle with AB = BC = 10 cm. Find the length of side AC using the Pythagorean theorem.
message_2: Since triangle ABC is an equilateral triangle, all its sides are equal in length. Therefore, AC = AB = BC = 10 cm. There is no need to use the Pythagorean theorem in this case, as all sides are already equal.
